em.style: background-color: #ffffff; color: #272727; font-family: proxima-nova, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

span.span: Iam very proud of the achievements of the Fort Recovery School Community during this extension of the school closure period. This is a challenging time for students, parents, grandparents, childcare providers and staff members. However, we are rising to the occasion and I thank you all for your part in those efforts.

div.h3: Current Important Information / Schedule of Learning

div.div: March 31st - All new updates are in red font

ul.li:
Elem K-2 |
April 3,4 ( 10am-11:30am )@ PreK / K Doors -Assignment packet turn in | New Assignment packet pick up
If you are unable to arrange pickup on those dates, please contact your childs teacher.

Elem 3-5 |
Students will utilize Google Classroom to communicate and collaborate with their teachers. Students will receive assignments and activities through Google Classroom. All Students should have a school provided chromebook.
Ohio Standardized Testing is canceled for 2019-2020 school year.

Middle School |
Students will utilize Google Classroom to communicate and collaborate with their teachers. Students will receive assignments and activities through Google Classroom. All Students should have a school provided chromebook.
Virtual study halls and individual online tutoring will be offered daily as well.(Click Here)
Ohio Standardized Testing is canceled for 2019-2020 school year.
8th Grade DC Trip is postponed. NEW INFORMATION HERE

High School |
Students will be utilizing a variety of online learning systems (Google, edmuntum, Zoom, etc). Students will recieved their assignments through these each day. All Students should either have their own device or a school provided laptop.
Ohio Standardized Testing is canceled for 2019-2020 school year.
Graduation Requirements - Determination is based on readiness for graduation as of March 12th and determined by the Principal with Teacher/ Counselor input.
Graduation Ceremony is currently still as planned
Prom is currently postponed. More details as they are available.

p.strong: Do we have days off during ERL?Yes!

ul.li: April 29th - No New Instruction Day (Teachers will not provide anything new, this is a day for all students to catch up)

p.strong: How do I contact my teacher during the ERL period?

ul.li: All teachers will be available online between the hours of 10am-3pm and 6:30pm-7:30pm M-F.
Teachers can also be contacted at any time via email. The complete list is located on the right side of this site under "Staff Contact Information".

p.strong: What do I do if my device breaks/has issues during the ERL period?

ul.li: Tech Support will be provided for all laptops and chromebooks during this time. Instructions are available on the right side of this site under "Technology Repair Requests".
For any other tech issues not related to equipment failure, please email the Tech Coordinator, Ryan Fullenkamp

p.strong: Which buildings will be open during the ERL period?

ul.li: All Fort Recovery Local Schools Buildings will be locked.
Staff that need to report to the buildings will be able to use a key fob for entry.
For student/parent entry to a building, come to the main entry for the building and ring the bell.

p.strong: How are my sports practices/schedules affected?

h3.span: ERL Extended through 5/1/20 / Admin Team Updates
